* Xavier Noria <fxn@...> [2007-12-12 09:50]:
> Nevertheless, can anyone fluent in HTTP explain whether a BODY
> in a GET request is actually disallowed by the spec? I tried
> to figure this out a while back and was unsure I got anything
> conclusive:
> 
>      http://www.advogato.org/person/fxn/diary/474.html

I continue being baffled at this confusion. What part of the spec
is unclear? Section 4.3 states that “unless explicitly allowed
for a request method, a message-body MUST NOT be sent”; section
9.3 indeed does not explictly allow a message-body in requests
with the GET method.

Therefore RFC 2616 forbids message bodies in GET requests.

I fail to see how any other conclusion is possible.
